item.title: BKChem
item.dc:creator: l4c
item.description: BKChem is a chemical drawing program written in Python. One of its notable features is SVG export.

item.title: Cantera
item.dc:creator: l4c
item.description: Cantera is a suite of object-oriented software tools for problems involving chemical kinetics, thermodynamics, and/or transport processes. You can use Cantera from Python or Matlab to handle problems in areas such as combustion, flame structure, detonations, electrochemical energy conversion, fuel cells, aqueous electrolytes, plasmas and thin-film deposition.

item.title: cclib
item.dc:creator: l4c
item.description: cclib (computational chemistry library) allows users to easily implement computational chemistry algorithms that use the results from calculations from any of a large number of popular computational chemistry packages (incl. GAMESS, GAMESS-UK, Jaguar, Gaussian, Molpro and ADF).

item.title: CCP1GUI
item.dc:creator: l4c
item.description: CCP1GUI is a free, extensible Graphical User Interface (GUI) developed for GAMESS-UK, but also supporting other packages. The GUI has been built around the Python open-source programming language and the VTK visualisation toolkit. It has support for conventional formats such as Z-matrix and PDB, as well as programme-specific formats for CHARMM, ChemShell, XMol and Gaussian.

item.title: Computational Crystallography Toolbox
item.dc:creator: l4c
item.description: The Computational Crystallography Toolbox (cctbx) is a collection of fundamental procedures for Computational Crystallography. It includes a unit cell toolbox , a space group toolbox and an element toolbox for the handling of scattering factors and other element properties.

item.title: Frowns
item.dc:creator: l4c
item.description: Frowns is a chemoinformatics toolkit geared toward rapid development of chemistry-related algorithms.

item.title: GAMGI
item.dc:creator: l4c
item.description: GAMGI (General Atomistic Modelling Graphic Interface) is an object-oriented program aiming to handle all aspects directly related with building, viewing and analysing atomic strucures, such as molecules, crystals, glasses, liquids, etc.

item.title: GaussSum
item.dc:creator: l4c
item.description: GaussSum is a GUI application that can analyse the output of Gaussian 98/03, ADF, GAMESS (US), GAMESS (UK), and PC-GAMESS calculations to extract and calculate useful information. This includes the progress of the SCF cycles, geometry optimisation, UV-Vis/IR/Raman spectra, MO levels, MO contributions and more.

item.title: gElemental
item.dc:creator: l4c
item.description: gElemental is a periodic table viewer derived from GPeriodic that provides detailed information on the chemical elements. It uses the GTK+ toolkit and is available for Linux and other GTK+ platforms. It also provides Python bindings to the data, which is stored in a separate data library.

item.title: MMTK
item.dc:creator: l4c
item.description: MMTK (the Molecular Modelling Toolkit) is a program library for molecular simulation applications. In addition to providing ready-to-use implementations of standard algorithms, MMTK serves as a code basis that can be easily extended and modified to deal with standard and non-standard problems in molecular simulations.
